metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7496 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
GNOME Display Manager (gdm) before 3.18.2 allows physically proximateattackers to bypass the lock screen by holding the Escape key.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7496` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdm3 - 3.24.2-1ubuntu9
gir1.2-gdm-1.0 - 3.24.2-1ubuntu9
libgdm1 - 3.24.2-1ubuntu9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdm3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.24.2-1ubuntu9').
